7:00 The US government, agreeing to provide Kodak, with advance warning of upcoming nuclear tests, answers a question that has circulated within our family for decades. My paternal grandfather worked at Kodak, in Toronto, Ontario, for over 40 years, retiring in 1967. Although the tests were officially secret, Kodak Canada somehow received notice of impending blasts. The workers were instructed to place large sheets of lead over the sheets of photographic X-ray film. The film was protected, by this means. If the lead sheets were not placed, the radiation would get trapped in the morning dew, on the roof of the Kodak factory, and then pass through six concrete floors and damage the film. If this process was not followed, the film had to be discarded.

As a child in Calgary I noted an article in Time or News Week that gave a map of the radio active fallout plumes from Soviet tests in the Arctic island of Nova Zemla. It also left out any data for Canada. It interestingly showed high levels in Alaska (no surprise) and about 1/2 the level in Montana. Note this pattern flowed into the Yukon and Northwest Territories then turned south along the East front of the Rocky Mountains toward Montana while spreading out Eastwards. My conclusion as an 8 year old was infuriation that the Canadian Goverment in Ottawa was lying to us in Alberta and the milk I was drinking was contaminated. In 1960 at age 10 I moved to Brisbane Queensland so I was only further contaminated in a much much lesser way by a very few French tests in the South Pacific which had to travel around 5/6ths of the
planet to reach our Queensland coastal pastures. The map from this video shows that I was also exposed to flow North along the Rocky Mountain Front of contamination from U.S. tests in the 50s
Well fingers crossed -- so far -- cancer free in my 72nd winter.

Nearly forty years ago I had a lecture from "Cal V....", a Kodak engineer who had as a Kodak engineer previously supervised the surveillance of Cuba before the Cuban Missile Crisis.  He told us that, since black and white photographic paper had an infinite "MTF," modulation transfer function, the simplest way to visualize the pictures were to magnify the whole roll until it was big enough.  They built a special twenty-foot high room with two, two-story long rollers standing vertically in one corner, magnified the original picture rolls to two stories high, and fed the roll of film off one roller, around rollers in the other three corners, and then back on the second corner roller.  Women (They used women because their abilities to see detail were better.) walked around the room, with a second group walking around a scaffold placed halfway up the roll of film, and looked for anything out of the ordinary.  The rest is history.

Sometime during the 1970's or '80's, Proctor & Gamble were attempting to build radiation detection chambers for their research labs in Cincinnati. Not matter what they did, they could not eliminate the background radiation inside the test vessels. The problem they found was that any steel used in the casings, no matter what year it was procured contained radioactive particles.
Finally, to secure a particle free source they searched the US for steel stocks originally produced before Trinity, and not re-manufactured since. They still had to acid-wash the rust off the outsides of the steel plates, as the rust was also found to be radioactive.
According to a top research chemist at P&G that I spoke with, finding this steel was VERY difficult.

You left out a very important plant.  The Eastman/Kodak plant in Kingsport, TN.  100 miles up river from Oak Ridge.  That plant spun off a third Eastman subsidiary, Holston Defense, during the late 30's early 40's.  Eastman made plastics and other chemicals, Kodak made film, and Holston defense made things that go boom.  (Often from byproducts of the other processes.)  They supplied Oak Ridge with chemicals and munitions.  You don't often hear about those plants, because people didn't talk about them, but Eastman is now headquartered in Kingsport.  Kodak knew what was going on, because their, "brother" was part of it. They couldn't just come out and say they knew what was going on though.  People up here in East Tennessee were proud of what they had been a part of, but were not able to talk about it for years.  This was technology that would have taken decades to develop that they had to do in less than five years.  There were a lot of unintended consequences because of the rush.  Many of those consequences remained secret for years.  Fall out was part of that.  Holston Defense would go on to be a major world supplier of RDX and C4 before being bought by BAE Systems.  Kodak would be phased out in the 90s, as film was replaced by digital.  Eastman and Oak Ridge Laboratories are still around.  Kodak knew, and by offering to sue the government, it would expose the extent of the fall out.  The government chose to keep it quiet and that's why those results were in a 1949 academic paper and not court documents.

Here's a fun bit of information: the mechanism which allows viruses, bacteria, and immune stimulants to enter the central nervous system is related to a compromised immune system. Environmental factors lead to compromised immune systems.

Vaccines such as Pertussis and MMR (Measles Mumps Rubella) can cause encephalitis. Encephalitis is an auto-immune condition that can effect the CNS (Central Nervous System) and the neurons in the the brain. When permeation of the BBB (Blood Brain Boundary) occurs by a virus, bacteria, part of a virus, or immune stimulant through the lymphatic system the immune response in the CNS and brain causes the anti-bodies which normally fight infections to instead attack the neural receptors because they are similar to the receptor sights on viruses.

Encephalitis can cause ABI (Acquired Brain Injury) which presents with the same range of symptoms as severe ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder). In fact, encephalitis is often extremely difficult to diagnose, and lies well beyond the scope of most doctors and hospital workers. Some neurologists are specialized in understanding encephalitis, while others specialize in genetic disorders like ASD. There is a conflict of diagnoses because the severe range of ASD is not well understood, not confirmed to be genetic, suspected to be caused by viruses/bacteria/immune stimulants, and where the most tragic cases unfold.

Encephalitis is covered under the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program in accordance with section 312(b) of the National Childhood Vaccine Injury Act of 1986. The Vaccine Injury Table is provided by the HRSA (Health Resources and Services Administration) and the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention). Autism is not covered by the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program.

Encephalitis could easily be mistaken as severe ASD. In that case the family has no compensation to help them care for a severely disabled child. In the worst case the infant may die of SIDS (Sudden Infant Death Syndrome) and due to bruising and necrosis caused by encephalitis it may be determined that the mother shook or abused her child; several mothers have been wrongfully convicted and put in jail after losing a child.

Now mothers like this are subjected to meme like ridicule and group slander/bullying.

Don't take my word for it; go look at videos of a child who has autism vs. encephalitis. Ask a neurologist if there is a possibility of misdiagnosis.

I couldn't figure out what would motivate them to hide the truth; but when I realized the mechanism that allows encephalitis to strike is a compromised immune system due to environmental factors; that was the KEY; corporate/military industrial pollution = class action lawsuits.

When testing went underground the U.S. Atomic Energy Agency (AEC) insisted it was done safely. The U.S. conducted a bit over 830 nuclear explosives underground. A U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) report, issued in April of 1997, contained an estimate of the costs of a partial cleanup of the deposited radioactive blast debris. The estimate came to $7.29 trillion. That agency deemed such a cleanup as being impractical on several grounds.

There was no mention of the emission of plutonium-239 in the blasts, in this video. One reason for that is details remain classified SECRET-RESTRICTED DATA. Those Pu-239 particles will remain a potential hazard for at least a half-million years.

Most nuclear detonations dispersed over a half-kilogram of Pu-239 as extremely fine particles. It can now be measured in the sediments of the oceans.

At 3:57 nuclear fission does not really work this way. All the credit should go to the female scientist Lise Meitner along with her nephew, Otto Frisch.
She is the Nobel Prize winning scientist that should be given all due credit to the understanding of how a radioactive nucleolus undergoes "fission". In reality the nucleolus does not "split" but rather undergoes an "explosion" of sorts. It does not "split" as we usually think of the term. Uranium and Plutonium atoms do not "split" when they undergo nuclear fission, they "explode". This is why the Nazi's were trying make "heavy water" so that they could slow down the neutrons that were aimed at other Uranium atoms. The extra neutron does not really "cut like a knife" as we have been lead to believe as kids in grammar school text books. What really happens is that the already "overstuffed" nucleus' are already "wobbling" with high temperatures in overstuffed wobbling situations. Instead of the old philosophy of having one extra neutron speed past and "slice" through the extra nucleolus, what really happens is that the extra neutron is "slowed down enough" to hopefully "attach" itself on to an already "overstuffed" wobbling nuclear mass. Once the overstuffed wobbling mass happens to "catch" one more extra neutron, or another piece of flying debris, this extra neutron attaches itself onto another nearby already "overstuffed wobbling" vibrating mass. The extra neutron, (or flying piece of debris) if slowed down and is lucky enough to attach itself onto an already overstuffed wobbling mass of neutrons, it will allow another explosion of sorts to occur. It will (not split) because the nucleolus is already super critical and can't handle any more wobbling from other free flying neutrons, but it will "explode" if another piece of debris attaches itself to an already overstuffed wobbling mass of overstuffed nuclear wobbling particles, like plutonium or U-235, which is already so unstable that it's wobbling mass is ready to intercept anything that might be allowed to attached to it, like another neutron.
Once an extra free flying random neutron is allowed to attach itself to another overstuffed atom of plutonium or Uranium 235, the nucleolus will accept "only" one more piece of junk (most likely another neutron) before the chit hits the fan. Then it will cause the center mass to "over wobble" and explode giving off other bits and pieces of free flying debris. Some of those exploded bits and pieces of debris will go on to attach near other over stuffed wobbling super critical atoms that will also "super wobble" and will "explode". They may not "split", but they explode giving off more debris causing a "chain reaction allowing other wobbling atoms that are already overstuffed to accept one more piece of debris before it too be "explode".
If anybody requires a citation to support this process, please refer to the book/audio book "E=MC2 by David Bodonis. It is generally accepted that this theory is from the mind of a woman with assistance from her nephew, Otto Frisch, who co-discovered the process while spending their time on snow skies in the cold woods during a beautiful light snow shower. Her name is Lisa Meitner, the Nobel prize winning genius who discovered nuclear fission, a term coined by her and given credit to her by Nobel authorities. But being a woman at the time, historically she was wrongfully overlooked by the Nazis as a Jewish female scientist when the Nazi's did not permit scientific credit to persons of her heritage.
It may have been her nephew, Otto Frisch who helped her discover the way an overstuffed nuclease divides during a radioactive disintegration of a particle. Meitner is known as the "Mother of the Atomic Bomb" because she discovered the theory of nuclear fission along with her nephew, Otto Frisch. She was the first to understand that a free neutron didn't need to go "fast" in order to split and atom. She realized that only "one extra neutron" was needed to fly by slowly enough that should it "attach" to an already overstuffed wobbling unstable mass, the free flying neutron will attach to another and make the other mass "super wobble" until it can not longer handle the vibrations. It will become "super critical" and "explode". It would not split, as we haver been taught in elementary school, but it would explode.
In short, Lisa Meitner first discovered the atomic bomb's essential theory of how a super critical particle might (explode). Lise Meitner made it clear that a nuclear mass does not "split", but rather it becomes so unstable it "explodes".

No one knew what radioactivity and radioactive elements did to living tissue. Radioactive isotopes were just beginning to be discovered. In dry goods stores there was a box about the size of a curbside postal pick up box. It was an X-ra;y machine. There was a slot to stick your feet into to see how your shoes fit. It's called THE BOMB PULSE.

Scientists have also used the increase in atmospheric carbon-14 formed by atmospheric atom bomb tests to age human tissues and even quantify the age of the longest living vertebrate, the Greenland shark.

The rise in carbon-14 was exponential until the test ban treaty then fell exponentially. Any thing living in that period took on the carbon-14 levels at the time. If the living tissues are continually remade, like your skin or gut tissues they then will have the level of carbon-14 of the day you were tested - presumably in the future when the levels are lower. If however you sample tissues that don't renew, like the lens tissue in your eye, then that keeps the carbon-14 levels of the day it stopped growing, for humans around puberty.

So this method has been used to tell us how quickly tissues in the human body renew - and we can only do this for people born between 1950 and 1970, i.e. people born when the levels of carbon-14 in the atmosphere were higher than background.

The data shows that tissues in our hearts don't renew quickly, around about 1% per year in adults, so that's why people who damage their hearts don't recover well.

For the Greenland sharks, scientists measured the radioactivity in the lens tissue of sharks accidentally caught in fishing nets. They found the sharks with traces of the bomb pulse were actually the shorter ones <1 metre in length, making them around 60-70 years old.This meant the larger sharks >5meters in length were an average 392 years old! A five meter shark in Greenland today was born in 1600, when Charles the 1st was on the throne in England.

Remarkably the Greenland shark becomes sexually mature after 150 years !!!

This information has been incredibly useful in conservation of this incredible species of fish.

Nice documentary on how the US Government is out of control, but you missed a few damning bits of history. First, in the mid-1950s, then a decade later, the US Army, under supervision of the United States Atomic Energy Commission. Sprayed Strontium-90 and radioactive Cobalt over the impoverished areas of East St. Louis. At the time, the population was mixed White/Black. It was designed to simulate fallout conditions over a major populace and the resulting health issues it would cause. This was cleverly disguised as a "Baby Teeth Survey" to understand the risks of Atomic testing in Nevada. A test site that would be known to have the prevailing winds to disperse radioactive particles across the Plains, the Mid-West, as far as NYC.

There was a November 1986 Congressional Report , PREPARED BY THE SUBCOMMITTEE ON ENERGY CONSERVATION AND POWER OF THE COMMITTEE ON ENERGY AND U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES, entitled
'AMERICAN NUCLEAR GUINEA PIGS: THREE DECADES OF RADIATION EXPERIMENTS ON U.S. CITIZENS REPORT'
This report goes into detail the extensive amount of nuclear human guinea pig testing that went on. The vast majority of testing done without the research victim's knowledge. There are some notable organizations directly involved in this human suffering, like MIT, Columbia University, Washington State University, Universities of Chicago, California (SF) and Rochester.

There there was live atomic testing that occurred underground, in the Tatum Salt Dome 20 miles SW of Hattiesburg, Mississippi. Drilling thru 7 water aquifers into the Salt dome, as part of the Project Dribble nuclear test series, a nuclear device was set off in the bore hole for Project Salmon in 1964. In Project Sterling in 1966 erupted another low yield nuclear device. This was followed up in 1969 and 1970 with up a liquid methane/liquid oxygen of similar kinetic yield and test for any leaking into the permeated aquifers. All done under the guise of detecting underground nuclear tests from the treaty ban.

Fun fact: A few years ago, a friend of mine went skiing with a group of people that he barely new, and they shared a cottage together in the mountains for a few days. Most people do not understand what having trace level radioactive contamination might mean to them. You should add a comparison just so they know. Compare the leftover contamination from the nuclear tests to the ALL NATURAL potassium-40 in our bodies which was has been there FOREVER. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potassium-40#Contribution_to_natural_radioactivity says the following:

"Potassium-40 is the largest source of natural radioactivity in animals including humans. A 70 kg human body contains about 140 grams of potassium, hence about 0.000117 × 140 = 0.0164 grams of K; whose decay produces about 4,300 disintegrations per second (becquerel) continuously throughout the life of the body."

In other words if you weigh 70 kilograms (154 pounds) and you had a magical Geiger counter which would click for every single decay of a potassium 40 nucleus occurring in your body then that magical Geiger counter would not be clicking, it would be singing a very high-pitched note at you. Remember that that is NATURAL radiation which is there and always has been there, in all of our ancestors forever, varying only with our weight.

I think you do a disservice to people by scaring them talking about the strontium 90 in their bones without giving them any sort of comparison to something which they can relate to.

A few corrections by an actual nuke. Radium does NOT glow unless there is a massive enough quantity to cause Cerencov radiation (blue light generated when a particle exceeds the speed of light in the medium, in this case, air. an optical shock wave) Even then the glow is faint. Radium dials and watches glowed brightly because the radium is mixed with silver-activated zinc sulfide. ZnS absorbs an alpha particle, is excited to a higher energy state and when it falls back to the ground energy state, it gives off that characteristic green glow.

Regarding alleged deaths from I-131 contamination of milk, the 8000 excess deaths were determined by using the long discredited Linear No Threshold (LNT). Here is an analogy I like to use to show how silly this theory is. Suppose I took a bullet and gently tapped you on the chest until I had delivered 1000 ft-lbs. Other than being annoyed, you'd still be perfectly alive and OK. If I delivered that same energy all at once as a rifle shot to the chest, you'd be dead. The LNT says that any amount of radiation, regardless of the speed delivered (dose rate) is harmful. So back to our analogy. Using the LNT theory, after I had tapped your chest enough to deliver 1000 ft-lbs, you'd be dead. Absurd, isn't it.

I could find no raw data on the net so I did a few back-of-the-matchbook calculations and using a Gaussian distribution of the dose delivered to the children, I estimate the true death rate to be less than 500, probably less than 200. The panty-wetters will whine that "that's 200 too many". I wonder what the death and disablement statistics were for Polio back then.

The model that best fits the evidence is the radiation hormesis theory. This theory states that low level radiation exposure, especially if it is chronic, is actually good for the person. There is a threshold above which the radiation again becomes harmful. Probably the greatest example of this is the famous radioactive high rise apartments in Taiwan. A cancer therapy source had been illegally disposed of in a scrap metal stream. This scrap was melted and extruded into I-beams. Several high rise apartment buildings were built from these I-beams. The radiation dose was very high. It was discovered about 10 years (about 2 half-lives for cobalt-60) later when an occupant took a roll of film to be developed but the radiation had fogged it to black. Google "Taiwan radioactive buildings" for more info. The interesting thing was, when they studied the population, some of which had lived there the entire 10 years, the cancer rates of all types were DRAMATICALLY lower than the general population.

The LNT still hangs on simply because so many people are making so much money from it.

Radium doesn't glow. The particles released by the radioactive decay of radium causes radioluminescence in, you guessed it, radioluminescent compounds known as "phosphors". The best known types are copper-activated zinc sulfide and silver-activated zinc sulfide. Phosphors are often transition-metal compounds or rare-earth compounds of various types. This reporting is an example of taking a historical situation and not explaining the context.
The context of the events was that during WW2, the United States government was told by credible scientists that a nuclear bomb was possible, and that German scientists knew it was. The concern was that Germany would develop a nuclear bomb and use it on us.
That spurred the U.S. to work on a bomb here. It turned out that Germany did not seriously work on a nuclear bomb, so our fears were not vindicated. But because we did not know that until the war was nearly over, we did have cause to worry, and what we did was justified.
After the war, we learned that the Soviet Union had spies in our program, and they had stolen plans for our bomb. They made bombs of their own. Years later, they stole plans for our hydrogen bomb. So we were riddled with spies in our most secret projects, and that raises paranoia if nothing else would.
Conducting tests that mildly threatened Americans was seen as being completely justified.

One of the most expensive steels in the world is sourced from Scapa Flow. Scapa is not a smelter, nor is it a mine. This doesn't surprise me. When I was a cinematographer and had light fog problems with a can of raw film stock I found myself talking to technicians in Kodak's Hollywood office who analyzed my can of film and followed it up the distribution chain. They were on it immediately and had answers their questions to their satisfaction quickly. They never said what the problem was but I got a few cans of 5247 for the cartoon studio that I was working for. They were pleasantly awesome to deal with and I got a great tour of the tech part of their Hollywood facility and subsequently was able to screen negative film with their special "easy on the film" projector. Kodak took quality control very seriously.

My mother and her siblings lived in southern Utah during the nuclear tests in Nevada. People who lived in the path of the fallout have been called "Down Wind-ers." My biological grandmother, one of my uncles, and my step- grandmother all died of cancer believed to have been caused by the fallout decades after they were exposed. I have heard countless horror stories of people who lived in the area and about the people they've lost. The fact that the government originally thought of a place that would expose less of the country (but almost definitely the southern US, Mexico, and Central America) and then moved to an area based on convenience and expediting the process speaks volumes of the paranoia of the age. They wanted the bombs to be made and tested as fast as possible to beat the Red Menace.

Something similar happened in Australia in the 50s and early 60s.
A couple of years ago I saw a documentary on Belgium TV about this. An Australian scientist in Adelaide who used a geiger counter for tests noticed that the counter started to react, but not at his experiment, but at the window where rain was poring down. He notified authorities who came and confiscated his geiger counter.
Later it turned out that there had been an atomic test, but that the wind had changed and the fallout was blown to Adelaide.

The documentary also showed that there was a secret program to collect bone samples from deceased people and send them to a central location. This continued until late 70's.

Interesting possible correlation that took me 20 years of research to put together a possible hypothesis. The effect was a higher than normal cancer rate in Titusville Florida in those between 60 and 75 years of age between 1995 and 2015. The cancer cases were non-specific carcinomas ranging from lungs and kidneys to brains. Generally, in blood filtering organs. Considering all of the KSC worker cancer patients were married and none of the spouses (not from West Virginia) were diagnosed with cancer, the source had a thread that possibly could lead to root cause. Titusville Florida was considered one of the areas with lower carcinogen identification and low level background radiation sources in the US which and was counter to the increased cancer rates. NASA was fairly careful (more careful as time and knowledge progressed) with life safety and carcinogens. So, how could this anomaly occur? One possibility is related to the workers that were part of the early days of Kennedy Space Center (KSC). These workers were young during the 50s. More importantly, a significant percentage of the workers at KSC were from West Virginia and were of a young age during the testing and possible fallout. Once all of the pieces began to come together, a picture of a possible cause began to form. The increased cancer rates appeared to correlate to KSC workers that grew up in the north east and mid west during the 50s. The interesting part of this story is that this is a rare case of a population that migrated from a possible hot zone to a cold zone in the 50s where the cancer rates may have followed the population and differed from the indigenous population. The insurance companies focused on the coal mines in West Virginia as a cause. Understandable for the lung cancer patients. Less so for the kidney and brain cancer patients. As a side note, kidney cancer patients are commonly identified as a cause of death related to brain and lung cancer masking the true cause. The reason for this is kidney cancer is often followed by kidney removal and post operative remaining cancer cells in the blood finding a filter organ (brain and lungs) to metastasize commonly resulting in a cause of death being diagnosed as lung cancer. When a patient passes who was recently diagnosed with lung cancer, doctors rarely (if ever) look for a scar from a previously ectomy (e.g. laparoscopic kidney removal) to note on the death certificate a possible previous diagnosis related to the cause of death.

Tritium is used to measure the age of ground water and how well an aquifer is confined.  If tritium is present in ground water, that means that the water was on the surface during the testing days and has since seeped into the aquifer.  If tritium is absent from the ground water, that means that the aquifer is pretty well confined as no surface water has seeped into the aquifer since before the testing days.

This video greatly exaggerates the actual health risks. For example, that graph at 9:20 comes from a paper https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11109179/ which does not meet modern scientific standards. There study suffers from inadequate scientific control, positive correlation is derived only from a subset of available data with no explanation given for this researcher degree of freedom (looks like p-hacking to me), and there's no dose response or other way to conclude causation from the mere correlation. You might think the basic biological plausibility that radiation causes mutation is sufficient to draw this conclusion, but no, the magnitude of background radiation is very large compared to this signal. In other words, there's essentially no biological plausibility.

The graph showing pCu/gm Ca and cancer occurrence vs. time is not very convincing.  The cancer rate is all over the map from '54 to '61.  It rises BEFORE the rise in 90Sr, shows a peak in '64, then plummets while the radiation level is still high.  If it hadn't been for the (probably spurious) 1964 peak, everyone would have recognized this as the poorly correlated noise that it likely is.   The danger of very low levels of radiation is overstated.  It's based on the "Linear No Threshold" model, which doesn't make biological sense and is poorly supported by data. Shame on you for the grossly irresponsible hysteria mongering relating to radiation you incorporated into this video. The "Baby tooth" study you referred to has been repeatedly shown to be entirely junk science. The "chief investigator" of it is known by the majority of those in science and medicine as a documented contemptible fraud. There is zero evidence of any harm even from strontium 90 from nuclea weapons fallout. Other than one instance where inches of dust of fallout, an hour or two after a huge yield H-bomb test in the Pacific covered the deck and crew of a Japanese fishing boat... and the facts even in that case show how relatively harmless radiation is. I suggest you educate yourself concerning biological effects of radiation, instead of parroting quack medicine and hysterical junk science in your Youtube video. NO ONE got ANY disease from distant windblown fallout from nuclear testing. Where did you say you got your MD? Where did you study epidemiology? People ARE less sensitive to radiation than is film. By a thousand fold or more. And there's a good reason why this is so:

Life evolved on earth for 3 billion years against a background of radiation. It evolved during that time highly sophisticated (and now at least in part documented and known) mechanisms for repairing damage to DNA (and other sorts of damage) made by radiation. Completely and rapidly (within hours). So unless one is exposed to truly massive doses of radiation at a high rate, that overwhelm these mechanisms, such minute exposures to radiation as those from radioactive fallout poses entirely zero risk to health... acutely or 50 years later.

Unlike our living cells, photographic film cannot repair the change ("damage") done by even a single particle of radiation hitting it.

Have you examined the major studies on which all of our knowledge of biological effects of radiation are known? The Hiroshima Nagasaki LSS study? The study of the "radium girls"? THe study of the thousands in Taiwan exposed to gamma rays from cobalt 60 in the rebar of their newly built apartment buildings? I'm a physician, and I have. These show how massively false are the claims you make in your video.

If you want to educate yourself, I suggest you start by reading the book "Nuclear is for Life", by acclaimed particle physicist Wade Allison, who spent years after his retirement educating himself extensively in medicine and epidemiology. There these (and many more) key studies are presented... and analyzed... and you will learn that near everything you said in this video that implies health risk from atomic testing fallout is entirely false. There are hundreds of expositions of this, but in my years of experience (as an MD with with a strong physical science background... in part from Harvard) studying this subject, "Nuclear is for Life" by Wade Allison is the single best one to read first.

"Nuclear is for life" is best ... or most quickly, anyway... understood by someone with a good general educated person type background in science and math. Given it is written by an Oxford professor of particle physics. But you appear to me to have the capability to rapidly absorb things requiring such general knowledge.

Please. Read it, and learn. You do such a good job in many of your other videos. And the titular material in this one about Kodak is excellent, too. it thus especially saddens me to see you spread outrageous, deadly, malignant, science-denying, superstition, quack medicine, and junk-science-based falsehood in this one with respect the (non existent) health dangers from "atomic bomb fallout".

I'm not supporting development or use of nuclear weapons, of course. These are horrific things. But they are horrific not from their radiation release, which is near entirely harmless, but due to their blast and heat. The problem is the massive falsehoods you parrot here do deadly harm to our heath, and to the health of the planet, by creating false fear of radiation, which underlies a lot of the false notions that nuclear power... the only thing capable of replacing fossil fuel as our source of electrical power in a way that can lower greenhouse gas emissions effectively... is other than overwhelmingly safe.

While radiation is basically harmless in all but extraordinary cases of massively high exposure, hysteria regarding the near entirely non-existent risk it poses (that you have encouraged in this video) KILLS. 2000 died from an entirely needless and prolonged evacuation of people from around Fukushima, most now agree. 10,000 to 100,000 women in Western Europe elected to have abortions for otherwise wanted pregnancies, hysterical about the possibility they would give birth to deformed children because they'd been exposed to the "plume of radiation" from the Chernobyl accident... a "plume" that, in Western Europe, entailed radiation levels a tiny fraction of low normal background radiation. These women exposed to that "plume of radiation" were exposed to radiation levels well over 1,000 times lower than the radiation exposure pregnant survivors of the atomic bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki experienced... and there was no higher incidence of birth defects there. Further, when the children born were followed for decades, there was ZERO indication of any ill effect that could be related to that radiation exposure. ZERO.

Please... I urge you... educate yourself, and stop spreading here on Youtube ignorant and deadly misinformation regarding the biological effects of radiation. Join those those of us trying to educate the public and policy makers by presenting scientific method based good clinical research / intellectually honest / evidence based science and science based medicine concerning this.

I suppose it's likely someone pointed this out to you before, but... just in case not...  radium-luminous watch/clock dials DO NOT glow because "radium glows", as you quite incorrectly implied in passing in this video.   They glow because zinc sulfide, an essential component of glow in the dark radium paint, phosphoresces when exposed to the emissions of the radium.  Such luminous dials wear out after a number of years (decades) NOT because of the radium wearing out (radium 226 has a 1600 year half life), but because the phosphor in the paint gets worn out with exposure to the radiation from radium.

In the early morning hours of July 16, 1945, great anticipation and fear ran rampant at White Sands Missile Range near Alamogordo, New Mexico. Robert Oppenheimer, director of the Manhattan Project, could hardly breathe. Years of secrecy, research, and tests were riding on this moment. "For the last few seconds, he stared directly ahead and when the announcer shouted Now!' and there came this tremendous burst of light followed abruptly there after by the deep growling of the explosion, his face relaxed into an expression of tremendous relief," recalled General L. R. Groves of Oppenheimer, in a memorandum for Secretary of War Stimson. The explosion carrying more power than 20,000 tons of TNT and visible for more than 200 miles succeeded. The world's first atomic bomb had been detonated.

With the advent of the nuclear age, new dilemmas in the art of warfare arose. The war in Europe had concluded in May. The Pacific war would receive full attention from the United States War Department. As late as May 1945, the U.S. was engaged in heavy fighting with the Japanese at Iwo Jima and Okinawa. In these most bloody conflicts, the United States had sustained more than 75,000 casualties. These victories insured the United States was within air striking distance of the Japanese mainland. The bombing of Pearl Harbor by the Japanese to initiate United States entrance into the war, just four years before, was still fresh on the minds of many Americans.

A feeling of vindication and a desire to end the war strengthened the resolve of the United States to quickly and decisively conclude it. President Harry Truman had many alternatives at his disposal for ending the war: invade the Japanese mainland, hold a demonstration of the destructive power of the atomic bomb for Japanese dignitaries, drop an atomic bomb on selected industrial Japanese cities, bomb and blockade the islands, wait for Soviet entry into the war on August 15, or mediate a compromised peace. Operation Olympia, a full scale landing of United States armed forces, was already planned for Kyushu on November 1, 1945 and a bomb and blockade plan had already been instituted over the Japanese mainland for several months.

The Japanese resolve to fight had been seriously hampered in the preceding months. Their losses at Iwo Jima and Okinawa had been staggering. Their navy had ceased to exist as an effective fighting force and the air corps had been decimated. American B-29's made bombing runs over military targets on the Japanese mainland an integral part of their air campaign. Japan's lack of air power hindered their ability to fight. The imprecision of bombing and the use of devastating city bombing in Europe eventually swayed United States Pacific theater military leaders to authorize bombing of Japanese mainland cities. Tokyo, Nagoya, Osaka, and Kobe all were decimated by incendiary and other bombs.

In all, hundreds of thousands of civilians were killed in these air strikes meant to deter the resolve of the Japanese people. Yet, Japanese resolve stayed strong and the idea of a bloody "house to house" invasion of the Japanese mainland would produce thousands more American and Allied casualties. The Allies in late July 1945 declared at Potsdam that the Japanese must unconditionally surrender.

After Japanese leaders flatly rejected the Potsdam Declaration, President Truman authorized use of the atomic bomb anytime after August 3, 1945. On the clear morning of August 6, the first atomic bomb, nicknamed Little Boy, was dropped on the city of Hiroshima. Leveling over 60 percent of the city, 70,000 residents died instantaneously in a searing flash of heat. Three days later, on August 9, a second bomb, Fat Man, was dropped on Nagasaki
Over 20,000 people died instantly. In the successive weeks, thousands more Japanese died from the after effects of the radiation exposure of the blast

I used to do gamma ray calibrations, for oil well logging tools in Edmonton Canada, when the Chernobyl accident happened. About 2 weeks after the accident, the outside background radiation level went up by about 10x its normal level, so we had to move all of the calibration activity indoors until the levels had returned to a more normal level. We had to continue to do indoor calibrations for a little over 6 months, when the outside levels had fallen (mostly washed away by rain) to about 1.75 times normal. The material that caused this was the Cesium-137 that was carried into the air by the fire at Chernobyl.

Here’s a note for all the commenters who have forgotten or never learned history.  President Truman was sitting between Stalin, who had lost a terrible number of troops on the Russian Western front and Churchill whose troops were standing next to American soldiers ready to invade the Japanese mainland in an effort to stop the war.  He needed leverage at that table.  The troops, perhaps it was your grandfather, needed a “Hail Mary” to survive the pacific war.  Whether all was known or not, the “A Bomb” was a life-saving answer.  The word of success that fateful morning, when a man-made fragment of a sun lit up the NM sky, was radioed to Truman.  He had his leverage.  Your birth was now going to happen. Subsequently scientists learned much more about side-effects and negotiators brought the spread of radiation to a standstill.  So, be happy you don’t have to speak Japanese - or German.  (Read or see “Man in the High Castle” by Dick.). Better yet, read up on your history.  It’ll make you less of a “chicken-hawk”!

I highly appreciate this video and want to call your attention to the leukemia cluster in Fallon, NV in the 90s.

A crapload of investigators came out and blamed the alkaline in the salt flats. Others blamed jet fuel from the local Naval Air Station. None of these cause such acute cases of leukemia.

A few of us military kids heard our parents mention something about "Project Shoal." This was an underground nuclear test performed in the early 60s that leaked radiation into the groundwater. It took 30 years to reach Fallon, but in the early to mid 90s, a bunch of us developed leukemia.

Just thought you'd like to know. A lot of this has been declassified recently.

I'm probably going to get a lot of flak for this, but the decision to test in Nevada instead of somewhere along the east coast might've been for the best, despite the inevitable cancer spikes. If the tests had been conducted in Virginia or Georgia, the prevailing winds would've sent the fallout into the Atlantic and MIGHT'VE even reached the UK and Africa. As such, the radioactive elements would've undoubtedly found their way into not only our sea-based food supply, but also Africa's and Europe's. Plus, the fallout would've been almost impossible to track.

By testing in Nevada, the fallout settled onto land and never moved elsewhere, which would've been the direct opposite of having the fallout dissipate into a gargantuan body of water hosting a fragile ecosystem at the mercy of ocean currents.

It's a lesser-of-two-evils choice. Of course, the ideal solution would've been to immediately convert over to underground testing after Nagasaki, but hindsight is often 20/20.

I also want to mention the low-background steel. As modern steel is processed using atmospheric air, any steel produced after the testing has significant amount of contamination from radionuclides. However, steel made before Trinity doesn't and therefore has got an application in radiation sensitive equipments such as Geiger counters. This type of steel is usually salvaged from ships that sunk before 1945. There is a Wikipedia article about this with some references at the bottom, and you can probably find more info on the internet.

I see comments like "radiation is radiation", which is nonsense. I see comments relating the power of the bomb to radiation released, which is also nonsense.

LET'S START WITH THE BASIC

1 - there is electromagnetic radiation. This travels basically at the speed of light. Gamma Rays, UV, Xrays, etc. These can kill you in a nuclear explosion long before the shock wave reaches you. It can fry you. Or it can knock quadrillions of electrons out of the atoms in your body, destroying molecules and your DNA, killing you in hours or days or in a bit longer term, some severe cancer.

2 - there is particle radiation. This is called by alpha and beta particles, emitted at great energies from the Sun (trapped in the Van Allen belts) or from radiactive elements.
Alpha and Beta particles do about the same thing than electromagnetic particles. They knock elemental particles from the atoms forming molecules in your body. Sometimes even causing small chain reactions that knock more particles from surrounding molecules.

3 - Radioactive elements have half life. The LONGER the half life of an element, the less radiactive it is... meaning that it emits particles at a VERY SLOW RATE. Elements with short half lifes are radiactive for a smaller time... because they emit a LOT of radioactive particles in a short time.

4 - Atomic Fission bombs are radioactive in two ways: they emit burts of electromagnetic radiation when they explode, AND THEY ARE INNEFICIENT, meaning only a small part of it's fissionable elements actually get fissioned. Over 95% of the radiative elements in Hiroshima did not fissioned, but instead, were POWDERED by the explosion of the 5% that fissioned, and were SPREAD in the air, like powder. That radioactive powder spread in the air, emitting alpha and beta particles.

5 - Pure fusion bombs could be clean, meaning they would only emit radiation when exploding, not leaving radiactivity behind. However, the tech for pure fusion bombs was expensive and the military was not that keen on it.

H-Bombs therefore work through two FISSION BOMBS that act as TRIGGER for the much more powerful fusion bomb. The fission bombs however leave radioactive elements behind, spread in the air.

6- the Chernobyl TV series is full of pseudoscience and urban myths.
